map.heuristic

Interface Heuristic

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EuclideanHeuristic, GridHeuristic, ManhattanHeuristic, ZeroHeuristic

    public interface Heuristic
    The Heuristic interface provides a method, to estimate the distance between two points based on a heuristic function.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Patrick Loka
    See Also:
    HeuristicStrategy, ZeroHeuristic, GridHeuristic, ManhattanHeuristic, EuclideanHeuristic

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double estimateDistance(Vector p, Vector q)
      Estimates the distance between two points p, q without considering a specific map or obstacles between p and q by a heuristic.

    • Method Detail

      • estimateDistance

        double estimateDistance(Vector p,
                        Vector q)
        Estimates the distance between two points p, q without considering a specific map or obstacles between p and q by a heuristic.

        A valid implementation fulfills following properties:
        (p,q) >= 0
        (p,p) == 0
        (p,q) == (q,p)
        (p,z) + (z,q) <= (p,q)
        Parameters:
        p,q - Points in a 2-dimensional vector space
        Returns:
        Estimated distance of p and q without considering a specific map or obstacles between p and q.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ZeroHeuristic, GridHeuristic, ManhattanHeuristic, EuclideanHeuristic
